title: Accordion
description: Accordions are panels or content areas that collapse vertically. They are generally presented as a list or a group. It is recommended that you control the open and close state of Accordions using JavaScript or a framework of your choice.

title: Alert
description: Alerts are used to display an emphasized message to the user. They are commonly themed based on the context of the message.

title: Badge
description: Badges, sometimes called Labels or Tags, are small descriptors that help identify or categorize content. Badges are styled similarly to buttons, but generally have less padding and / or a smaller font size.

title: Button
description: Buttons are used to handle user input. They are often used within forms, but are also used as links. Buttons are typically themed based on the context of their actions.

title: Button Group
description: Button groups are used to group a set of related actions. They are also sometimes used as toolbars. They can be displayed in a row or stacked vertically.

title: Card
description: Cards are used as containers for content. They sometimes have headers and footers that display a title or user actions.

title: Collapse
description: A Collapse is used to hide / show content. Collapses commonly have a title and an arrow indicator that changes with the collapsed state.
